attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to have compulsory logo trousers, skirts or shirts
attributes.background: Many schools and academies are adding expensive logo trousers, skirts and shirts to their uniforms, for example increasing the cost of school trousers from £4.50 to £19.95. Often the opinions of parents are ignored, and families have to pay these large bills or face having their children excluded.
attributes.additional_details: If you wish to see evidence of this, look at the cost of uniform providers such as Just Schoolwear or Schoolwear Solutions for logo items. Then compare to a high street retailer such as George, Tesco or Sainsbury.

attributes.action: The UK Government to regularly measure household food insecurity across the UK.
attributes.background: It's estimated that millions of people in the UK are food insecure. Food insecurity can vary from worrying about not being able to access enough food to going whole days without eating. Without regular monitoring, we cannot begin to understand the true scale of the problem nor its impact on health.
attributes.additional_details: Emma Lewell-Buck's Food Insecurity Bill would require the government to routinely monitor and report on food insecurity. Trussell Trust food bank statistics demonstrate growing food poverty but there are many more independent food banks and other food aid providers operating today. And we know that help is accessed as a last resort -  most food insecurity is hidden from view. Food insecurity is measured in Canada which means its health implications and long-term costs are understood.

attributes.action: Create a UK wide waste and recycling system.
attributes.background: The current waste and recycling system is broken down into counties or smaller regions of the country which are able to recycle different products, have different coloured signage, and for the most part a complete lack of public reycling facilities.We could be recycling more and not adding confusion
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government has said it will reduce plastic waste and increase recycling rates. This coupled with China no longer taking plastic waste means that more needs to be done to recycle items in this country. Currently councils are only able to recycle certain items meaning that a lot of recycling across the country actually ends up in landfil/waste to energy.We need one system for the whole country so that no matter where you are it is clear which bin an item should go in and it will be recycled

attributes.action: Change the law on smashing a car window to release a dog from a hot car.
attributes.background: At present, members of the public risk being prosecuted for criminal damage if they act on instinct and smash the window of a vehicle to release a distressed dog which is trapped inside the vehicle in hot weather. The burden of proof is upon them to show that smashing the window was necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please change the law to allow for concerned members of the public to release animals (dogs) trapped inside vehicles by smashing a window in circumstances where it would be deemed reasonable to assume that the animal (dog) is suffering from heat stroke or is at imminent risk of suffering heatstroke. Place the burden of proof on the owner to demonstrate that the animal (dog) was not at risk.

attributes.action: Allow students' placements to count towards 30 hours funded childcare criteria
attributes.background:
Students studying a degree with an integrated placement are required to have more contact hours than those without therefore for parents, childcare can be difficult to fund.
University limitations of number of hours students can work mean additional income to fund childcare is difficult to obtain.
attributes.additional_details:
It is grossly unfair that placement hours are not considered when deciding who should qualify for the additional funding.

This petition calls for the government to have a review of the guidelines regarding the eligibility of the additional 15 hours funded childcare for three and four year olds, and to introduce new criteria that allows students with integrated placements within their degree to have their placement hours taken into account when applying for additional funded childcare.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to introduce car parking charges for common land car parks
attributes.background: With an increasing obese population charging to park by common land discourages the access to outdoor activities and discriminates the poorer. The maintenance of car parks in common land car parks should be covered by existing local taxes as it is for parks and children’s playgrounds .

attributes.action: Guaranteed help at A&E to prevent avoidable deaths from suicide
attributes.background: When you feel suicidal in the UK, doctors tell you to go to A&E. What you will find there is based on luck: will you find compassion? Or will you be judged and turned away? A majority of the time, the latter. Asking for help can be a turning point for individuals in crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be a nation-wide, guaranteed response to individuals seeking help for suicidal thoughts and feelings in our hospitals. 
 
The following procedure should be guaranteed as a standard response: 
 
1. The contemplation of suicide or signs of severe mental distress is classified as a medical emergency. 
2. The individual is processed on-site immediately. 
3. The individual is taken to a “Calm Room”. 
4. ‘Suicide Guarantee’ trained staff member speaks with the individual with attentive compassion. 
5. A specialist professional involves the individual in creating a written plan to assure their immediate safety and ongoing treatment and/or support.

attributes.action: Make parking in a disabled bay on private land without a Blue Badge illegal.
attributes.background: Unlike on-street Blue Badge parking bays it is not a criminal offence to use disabled parking bays on private land without a valid Blue Badge. The law needs to be changed so that offenders can be fined and/or points added to their license. This will prevent misuse in places like supermarkets.

attributes.action: Diagnosed mental health patients should receive free prescriptions
attributes.background: Without medication mental health patients can die, they are three times more likely to develop additional physical problems such as diabetes, heart disease and addictions, all of which can reduce life expectancy.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental illness is considered a disability, question behaviour, whether stable and/or taking medication. 
Mind organisation have already researched the definition and terms of disability in conjunction with the Equality Act, 2010. Mental health is included. 
Diagnosed mental health problems should qualify an individual for free prescriptions in the same way as some medical conditions and physical disabilities.

attributes.action: Provide separate labour wards for women giving birth to stillborn babies.
attributes.background: I gave birth to my dead baby boy on a maternity ward 17 years ago surrounded by crying babies. It was soul destroying knowing others were celebrating new life, when a life had been taken from me. Future mothers should never experience this tragedy and is why I am calling for legislative change.
attributes.additional_details:
According to stillbirth charity 'Tommy's Organisation', one in every 225 births ends in stillbirth in the UK - making that nine babies every day. It's also estimated that 4.2 million are living with depression associated with previous stillbirth - a number which cannot go ignored.

It's imperative to change the future of these bereaved mothers by creating the best environment possible for one to give birth to a dead child, and to ensure we provide the tools to be able to cope with such a loss.

attributes.action: Prevent Freeholders from passing cladding costs to leaseholders
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 72 people lost their lives in the Grenfell Tower fire in London.  Thousands of people are still living in tower blocks with unsafe cladding over a year later. Over 400 high-rise flats still have the same type of cladding blamed for the rapid spread of the deadly blaze.
attributes.additional_details: Leaseholders are forced to pay £millions to fix cladding and more, costs unfairly passing to us even though we were not responsible for construction or approvals. Our homes won't be made safe until funds are in place. Our flats are also unsellable and unmortgageable until works are completed, We call on parliament to make it illegal to pass on any costs related to making our homes safe, to compensate those of us who've paid for works and to require homes be made safe as soon as practicable.

attributes.action: Ban balloon and sky lanterns release to celebrate or commemorate someone.
attributes.background:
The impact on environment and danger to wildlife in undeniable. 
The response to the similar petition, given by the Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs on 22 May 2018 is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
There are other, creative and meaningful ways we can celebrate and remember our loved ones.
Introducing the ban will send a clear message and save lives on our already tragically polluted planet. We're ought to protect them, for everyone's sake.
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/balloon-releases-are-killing-animals/

http://encenter.org/visit-us/programs/birthday-parties/balloons/

attributes.action: Change the laws for fireworks only to use silent fireworks.
attributes.background: Every year when firework season is upon us it’s fun for many a nightmare for our pets and wildlife .listening to others it’s a very real problem ,and it seems the most benefit is too manufacturers making all kinds of tablets, plug ins, sprays thunder shirts etc to try and combat the problem.
attributes.additional_details: A town in Italy decided enough was enough and that pets and wildlife were being affected by these dinamite fireworks. That go off like bombs. And have now changed to silent fireworks, they still enjoy the display which could be musical but saves the stress from the incredible noises. (Collecchio in Italy ).

attributes.action: Offer a biopsy to all women referred to a breast cancer clinic
attributes.background: I want every women referred to a breast clinic with a lump in there breast to have a biopsy rather than an ultrasound so they can be told 100% if the lump is cancerous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife went to a breast clinic with a lump in her breast where the consultant only did a ultrasound and not a biopsy. She was told it definitely wasn't cancer. They never did anymore investigating in to her lump as they didn't think it was cancer. Three years later the same lump got a biopsy and it was cancer. My wife lost her life because she didn’t get a biopsy to tell us 100% if it was cancer.

attributes.action:
Justice for cats
Make it law to report hitting a cat
attributes.background: I lost my cat a few years ago to a taxi car speeding down my road my road s a no through road)  he new he had hit her but carried on to collect his ride. On the way back acknowledging he knew he hit her and left the seen. If she was a dog she would have had rights but cats don’t. Justice for cats.
attributes.additional_details: I love my cats as much as I loved my dog.

attributes.action: Remove forced adoption from Britain
attributes.background: In Ireland, France and Spain forced adoption is illegal; in Britain, it is not. Why have we got less parental rights?
attributes.additional_details:
The role of social services is to support families and protect children from abuse, that shouldn't include taking children away from their parents with no proof of abuse, and without trying to work with families; these children are being separated from siblings and put at much more risk. The children are then getting put up for adoption with family members still fighting to keep them; babies and toddlers are getting put up for adoption extremely fast without parents being found guilty of anything.

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/couple-cleared-child-cruelty-reveal-6599877

https://forced-adoption.com/what-you-can-do/

attributes.action: Create new laws around letting agents to ensure students don’t get overcharged
attributes.background: Many students get overcharged when leaving their properties because it is very easy to become blinded by the confusion of the big wide world. I want laws to be changed so landlords/letting agents cannot try to charge ridiculous prices for basic things like cleaning and painting.
attributes.additional_details: I have been charged over £1000 for leaving my property after my 2nd year at University for just cleaning, gardening and painting. I have started a Facebook petition reaching out to other students and so far I have over 300 cases. I feel that it’s too easy for students to fall into these traps and accept these charges, as we do not understand the full breakdown of these costs. There needs to be a law to ban landlords and letting agents charging more than 10% mark up on services at the end of tenancies. Students are being exploited.

attributes.action: We call on Goverment to provide an extra £10M a year for Leicestershire Police.
attributes.background:
We call on the Home Secretary to provide an extra £10 million a year for overstretched Leicestershire Police.
It would provide 300 extra officers on the beat to fight increasing crime including shop lifting, burglaries & knife-crime.With fewer officers, the force is struggling to deal with crime.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more reported burglaries, instances of shoplifting, people dealing drugs and in some instances children as young as 12 are apparently selling drugs.
Unless something is done and soon, problems will only escalate. Resources are limited across the public sector but it is false economy not to deal with the situation.
People must be able to feel safe in their own homes, and city.
We are hoping that if enough people support the petition the issue will be debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future.
attributes.background: The recent BREXIT referendum limited the right of UK citizens to vote on the UK's future on the basis of residence. UK citizens, resident abroad, but still registered in electoral roles, were eligible. However, many others were disenfranchised and unable to vote on issues affecting their future.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens, working and living in the EU for more than 2 years before the Brexit referendum, were arbitrarily disenfranchised  by the UK Government, and were ineligible to vote on an issue that affected their future and legal standing in the EU. Parliament must ensure that any future referendum affecting the governance of the UK must consult all UK citizens, regardless of residence. Local Consular offices charged with registering all UK citizens abroad, can verify their voting eligibility.

attributes.action: Ban the use of face coverings at protests and counter protests.
attributes.background: It has became common practice for protesters to attend protests with their faces totally covered. With the sole aim of causing trouble and escaping police prosecutions. The police rely heavily on video footage to enable prosecutions at later dates and away from a hostile crowd.
attributes.additional_details:
Being able to cover ones face empowers people to commit crimes of assault, criminal damage, racial abuse, etc, that they may not otherwise commit. Much the same as a fake profile online empowers people to say things that they would be to afraid to say on a real profile. 
A law would greatly aid the police in doing their job and keeping the peace at public protests and counter protests. I feel it would reduce the number of offences committed at protests considerably.

attributes.action: Parking on pavements, verges or footpaths to be made an offence in England.
attributes.background: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road.
attributes.additional_details: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths, – even on roads with no markings, invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road. This is further exacerbated for wheelchair users and parents using pushchairs etc. I feel that this is an increasingly common behaviour which will eventually result in an increasing death and injury toll. In this age of improving Health & Safety legislation this type of behaviour is a travesty.

attributes.action: Childrens social workers to be mental health awareness trained and SEN trained
attributes.background:
Children are ending up in care wrongly, as front line social workers are not equipped with mental health awareness training or SEN trained. 
Reports on emotional harm are written wrongly, resulting children end up in care with complex needs and challenges that are not met until they leave care.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 Children and young people suffer with mental health issues. Though it still seems to be over looked in Childrens social work. They often lack  to correctly identify  a bullied child, a grieving child or child struggling at school because of SEN needs. Families are being split up because of lack of basic training that should be mandatory at University level with a yearly review in the work place.

attributes.action: Allow Bashir Ahmadzai to stay in the UK indefinitely.
attributes.background: Bashir Ahmadzai came to the UK 6 years ago to escape the Taliban. He is profoundly deaf & court documents say he has “complex speech, language & communication difficulties”.  He is an extremely vulnerable young person who is under threat of deportation. We ask that he is allowed to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: For more information please read this comprehensive piece about Bashir's case by Aditya Chakrabortty which appeared in the Guardian on 26 June: https://amp.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jun/26/trump-british-brutality-us-mexico-border

attributes.action: Introduce statutory LGBT+ element for Initial Teacher & School Governor Training
attributes.background: A lack of training on the prevention of LGBT+ bullying, means providers like Stonewall & www.inclusionforall.co.uk often work with schools where LGBT+ bullying is already happening. Stonewall research shows almost half of LGBT pupils are bullied at school. Teachers must be trained from the start.
attributes.additional_details: The National LGBT Survey found that a third of respondents who were in education in 2016-2017 said that they experienced a negative reaction during that time due to them being, or people perceiving them to be, LGBT. The most frequent perpetrators of the respondents’ most serious incidents were other students (in 88% of cases) but a tenth (9%) were committed by teaching staff. The resulting action plan focuses heavily on ‘tackling’ not organisational culture change in order to prevent prejudice.

attributes.action: Vehicle theory test to include section on motorcycle awareness on the road
attributes.background: Please help change our vehical theory test in scotland! To include a mandatory section on how drivers and motorcycle riders can look out for each other on the road. So we can prevent a very high amount of Accidents regarding road users.
attributes.additional_details: 20% of all accidents on Scotland's non-build up roads involve motorbikes. Approximately 60% of all motorcycle fatlities in scotland occur on these carriageways. In 2017 their were 827 motorcycle accidents 34 were fatal. Not a single cause of motorbike accidents in 2017 were caused by flooded/icy road coditions. 50% of motorbike accidents in Scotland were 30mph or less! Riders are 40 times more likely to be KILLED than any other road user. We can change this! Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Introduce Emergency Visitor Visa for families of citizens with critical illness
attributes.background: My friend was diagnosed with cancer recently. Chemo makes her so sick that she struggles to take care of her 2 year daughter. Her mother applied for UK visitor visa to come and look after her and her family. However it was rejected saying she is not a genuine visitor and will not go back to Iran.
attributes.additional_details: A new visitor visa category should be introduced  for non-British immediate family members of British citizens with life threatening illnesses such as cancer or conditions requiring full-time care. This is to assist British citizens with family living outside of the UK in receiving the mental and physical support of their families, paramount to coping with their health issues and difficulties arising from their condition.

attributes.action: Bring back Appeal rights & Right to work for migrants
attributes.background:
Under Immigration Act 2014, most migrants lost their right of appeal -that took their basic rights away - like Access to employment, NHS & much more. These are some of the basic needs a person requires to sustain one self. 
This has lead to many migrants living in destitute conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of windrush incident,many of us are now awake as to what is happening in the society we live in.The whole country was left in shock. The migrants suffer everyday with these hostile policies.

We have recently seen a case of a Nigerian woman who despite facing difficulties got justice thru the courts. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/aug/21/court-says-seriously-ill-woman-can-work-while-fighting-uk-deportation

Please help in bringing back basic needs for these migrants.

attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: Reverse the Cuts to Youth Services
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand the reversal of funding cuts to youth services since 2010 (62%). Youth work plays an integral role in the development of young people but is being jeopardised by the lack of support currently available. We must work to prevent youth violence and support mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
Research conducted by the YMCA found that overall spending on youth services in England has fallen by £737m (62%) since 2010. Between 2012 and 2016, 600 youth centres closed, 3,500 youth workers lost their jobs and 140,000 places for young people went. 

Unison (the union) asked youth workers about the impact of youth service cuts; 83% said they were having an effect on crime and antisocial behaviour, and 71% said it was now harder for young people to stay in formal education.

attributes.action: Fund more medical research into Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Neuroblastoma is a Cancer In Children. Mostly under fives. 
It’s the most common form of Cancer In Babies.15% deaths in children.
One in 7000 children are affected.
The treatment is very aggressive and more support for the families diagnosed with Neuroblastoma is needed now.

attributes.action: Make it law that gluten free food in restaurants is not contaminated by gluten.
attributes.background: Food safety law in the UK is not strict enough around how gluten free food is made in restaurants. Restaurants offering gluten free options should have to ensure those meals are made in controlled environments, so the food cannot be contaminated by gluten which would make it unsafe for coeliacs.
attributes.additional_details: Coeliac disease is a serious auto immune disease affecting 1 in 100 people in the UK. Upon minimal contact with gluten the immune system is triggered to attack the bowel lining, which can happen without any noticeable symptoms. By law foods labelled ‘gluten free’ must contain no more than 20 parts per million gluten, but if restaurants do not take care to prevent kitchen contamination gluten free meals are likely exceeding this safe level and triggering an immune reaction in coeliac sufferers.

attributes.action: An Opt Out system with the Bone Marrow Register and more awareness in Education.
attributes.background:
Every day at least 5 people start their search for a bone marrow donor. There are currently only 2% of people in the UK registered. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany.
90% of donations take place via peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) collection, similar to giving blood.
attributes.additional_details:
Organ donation is highlighted with public campaigns as is blood donation. Both saves lives. Bone Marrow Donation is not. It needs more public awareness, more understanding within the communities and schools. It must be made compulsory within the school age of 14-16 years. It can reduce concerns and highlight the simplicity of the procedure, which will potentially save someone's life ! 
There should be an 'Opt Out' system where those who wish to not donate can remove themselves from the register.

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: Utilise Reading Prison as a Shelter for the Homeless
attributes.background: Reading currently has the highest number of homeless not only in Berkshire but in the South East; as taxpayers we're already paying for this building to be heated, the lights kept on and the water running, it just makes sense when there are people, our people, outside in the cold, wind and rain.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2013, Reading Prison which has a potential capacity to hold over 500 people, that has running water and still being heated, is just lying empty. 

So far it has cost the taxpayer in excess of a £1 Million to mothball. Unused for the last 5 years (save an art exhibition and the odd film production company using it for shooting locations), it seems to me almost criminal, when so many are in need of warmth and shelter to not utilise this for those of who find themselves homeless.

attributes.action: Allow EU nationals with permanent residence to participate in a People's Vote
attributes.background:
The prospect of parliamentary deadlock has revived talk of a second referendum. 
The Brexiteers lied during the campaign and broke election law for deliberately exceeding spending limits and making false promises.
The public deserves a chance to vote on the final deal.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of this, EU residents in the UK have studied, worked, paid taxes and contributed to the British society for many years. Many have permanent residence but not yet British citizenship. They have made the UK their home and they deserve to have a say in the (possible) upcoming referendum. 
Kindly consider this petition.

attributes.action: Keep British Summer Time (BST) all year round in UK
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST or Daylight Saving Time - DST) is 1 hour ahead of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). The UK has BST from late March to late October.  With BST there are lighter evenings, darker mornings, but lighter afternoons, greater happiness, fewer accidents and increased productivity

attributes.action: Condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments in taking the UK into the EEC
attributes.background: There has long been controversy as to the legality of Britain being a member of the EEC/EU. We believe that our entry into the EU was contrary to the Vienna Convention 1969 and the British Bill of Rights 1689. The Government must acknowledge this and condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments.
attributes.additional_details: Actions that violated the Vienna Convention could include secret negotiations, misleading the people and failing to conform with the constitution of the signature state. No Treaty is valid if people of that state are misled as to the intentions of a treaty and it is not made in "good faith". With the republication of document FCO 30/1048, we believe the 1970-79 Governments were complicit when assuring the people and UK Parliament that there was no question of surrendering national sovereignty.

attributes.action: Stop animals being used for street entertainment in order to gain money
attributes.background:
Animals are being used by buskers to gain money should be banned!
Animals are being abused, and treated cruelly
Any animal being used for street entertainment should be jailed and dogs siezed
attributes.additional_details: Dogs have been siezed by the rspca for abuse, ill health over the past two years already 17 dogs have been siezed, some through heat exhaustion, urine infections due to not being allowed to pee in the same place, they are wacked by their leads, water bowls are for show only, they are beaten back at base and also drugged this is no life for any animal, this has to stop!!

attributes.action: Make Zoroastrianism a part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Schools should teach pupils about Zoroastrianism. It is one of the world's oldest active religions. It is the first monotheistic faith centered in a cosmology of good and evil and an eschatology predicting the ultimate destruction of evil. Ascribed by Zarathustra who lived almost 3,500 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Zoroastrianism enters recorded history in the 5th-century BCE. It served as the state religion of the pre-Islamic Iranian empires for more than a millennium, from around 600 BCE to 650 CE.  Zoroastrianism was suppressed from the 7th century onwards following the Muslim conquest of Persia of 633–654. In 2015, there were reports of up to 100,000 converts in Iraqi Kurdistan. Zoroastrianism has influenced the Second Temple Judaism, Gnosticism, Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism.

attributes.action: Drop the EU Withdrawal Agreement on the basis that it is unconstitutional.
attributes.background: The EU Withdrawal Agreement (EUWA) stipulates that we will have no representation in the EU Parliament while mandating we still pay VAT at rates limited by the EU. This means British citizens will be taxed without representation which is unconstitutional and may set a "taxes for deals" precedent.
attributes.additional_details: VAT was introduced on joining the EEC. It replaced the similar Purchase tax to avoid double taxation. VAT is therefore an EU mandated tax, irrespective of whether the EU is the main beneficiary or because it's collected by HMRC. The EU control the rate for competition reasons between member states and will retain ultimate jurisdiction in the UK over it. This is not a petition to "get rid of" VAT, but against the ramifications and precedents the EUWA may have on our fundamental rights

attributes.action: Slash Home Office settlement and naturalisation fees: stop making a huge profit
attributes.background: Home Office charges £2,389 for indefinite leave to remain (per person for the main applicant and every dependant) a rise of 25% on 2016-17. It costs £243 to process each application. The settlement visa for an adult dependent has risen from £585 in 2008-09 to £3,250 in 2017-18, an increase of 450%.
attributes.additional_details:
Fees for immigration and nationality applications have steadily risen since 2010 including in the latest round of changes in April. 
Figures released to the BBC showed the Home Office made £800m in revenue from fees in six years. 
The Home Office made profits of up to 800% on some immigration applications from families. 
References : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jun/24/reduce-home-office-fees-say-mps-campaigners

attributes.action: Introduce reduced flexible working hours for breastfeeding parents
attributes.background:
There are benefits to mother and child for extended breastfeeding with the WHO recommends breastfeeding for the first 2 years of life. 
Many women find the return to work makes continuing breastfeeding difficult, other countries have support in place for this to continue.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries have support in place for breastfeeding to continue, eg Portugal has a 'breastfeeding license' which reduces the working day by 2 hours, this would allow a mother the optiond to arrive later, leave earlier, pop home during the day to feed or to use the time during the working day to pump to provide milk for when they are away.

Many women need to return to work and a change like this would allow them to provide financially as well as physically for their child.

attributes.action: Cancel Parliament's Summer Recess to sort out the Brexit Deal
attributes.background:
MPs have failed to agree a plan for Brexit and are clearly now struggling to fit the debate into their schedules, given that they all expect to be leaving Westminster for their Summer Holidays shortly.
We urgently need to ensure a good deal for Britain from the EU, ahead of Brexit in March 2019.

attributes.action: Repeal the two child limit to Tax Credits and Universal Credit.
attributes.background:
It is a glaring injustice. It breaks the link between the assessment of children’s needs and the support they receive. 
It will worsen child poverty.  
Not all women have control over their reproductive destiny. Compulsory disclosure requirements will re-traumatise rape victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women will never disclose rape to anyone. Reasons include trauma, self-protection, shame, and fear for others - including their child. To force them to do so is cruel and risks danger.
There is already evidence that it is influencing decisions on pregnancy termination.
How could it be paid for?
The Government says the two child limit will save just over a £1bn in 2019/20. Since the policy was announced, OBR forecasts for spending on personal tax credits in 2019/20 have reduced by £2.2bn.

attributes.action: Press the United Nations to make the dumping of all waste in the oceans illegal.
attributes.background: The only way to stop the polution of the oceans by plastic and other waste is to stop the dumping of urban waste at sea. The attempts that are being made to remove plastic and other waste from the oceans will only start to be effective once the dumping has stopped.

attributes.action: Make employment businesses that supply electrical workers require a licence.
attributes.background:
Employment businesses/agencies that supply labour within the electrical trade are notorious with breaking the rules.

One of the most common problems is workers not being paid or having deductions made from there wages, both of which are illegal practices!
attributes.additional_details:
The EWB Propose a licensing system similar to the GLAA (http://www.gla.gov.uk/) to help protect the workers from these unfair practices.


The law is very clear on what an employment business/agency can and can't do but as it stands it is difficult to bring them to justice.

With a licence in place it makes the jobs of unions such as the IWGB:EWB easier to fight for fairness for workers.

Its time for change within the electrical industry and these unfair practices that break the law to change.

attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for transplant recipients
attributes.background: Transplant patients are on immune suppressants and anti-rejection medication for the rest of their life. As with a lot of other illnesses, they shouldn't have to pay for them.

attributes.action: Fund Research to Prevent and Treat Asherman's Syndrome.
attributes.background: In 2009, I was pregnant with my one and only pregnancy. At my three-month scan, I was told there was no heartbeat and that I needed to have an ERPC. Following this I was diagnosed with Asherman's Syndrome, which then caused me to become infertile. This Silent Syndrome has been recognised since 1948.
attributes.additional_details: Asherman's Syndrome is scarring (adhesions) of the uterus. This scarring causes lighter periods or no periods at all and, in almost all women who are affected, infertility. It most often develops after a common minor operation called a D&C (dilation and curettage) and often following a missed miscarriage. In this case it's called an ERPC (evacuation of retained products of conception). It is estimated that around 60,000 - 100,000 D&Cs are carried out each year and many women remain undiagnosed.

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal to those who fought in France & Norway between 1939-40.
attributes.background: There have been medals awarded for most of the major campaigns of WW2 however one glaring omission has been a recognition of those who fought the Nazis in France and Norway period 1939-40. Many of these soldiers became POWs and endured many years suffering with no recognition for their sacrifice.
attributes.additional_details: A new campaign medal to retrospectively recognise the sacrifices of those who served in various theatres of WW2 is not without precedent - a Bomber Command clasp and Arctic Convoy medal have both been created in recent years. Thousands of men fought in Norway and in the desperate rearguard action in France in an attempt to halt the Nazi war machine including almost the entire 51st Highland Division. Their courage in the face of the enemy and fortitude as POWs deserves recognition.
